events.time: 5 pm - 10 pm Th -Fr.  11 am - 6 pm Sa-Su.
events.name: Eastside Culture Crawl

content.title: Eastside Culture Crawl
content.body: One of Vancouver's most loved events!  I will be opening my doors for this self-guided artist tour once again.  Vaccine passports are required for entry.  I will have a large selection of work on display and this is the one time each year when I sell my seconds.

events.time: 10 am - 9 pm W - F.  10 am - 7 pm Sa.  10 am - 5 pm Su.
events.name: Circle Craft Christmas Market

content.body: Western Canada's premier artisan market featuring close to 200 talented creators.

content.title: A Fresh Start
content.body: For me, the start of a new calendar year is an opportunity to pause and re-energize after what is always a very busy holiday season. It's important to keep playing and to try new things - to keep the creativity flowing and to embrace challenge and failure. I look forward to this quieter time of the year and to trying new things to keep myself and all of you excited with my work! Wish me luck!

content.title: Markets begin to re-open
content.body: I am thrilled to be able once again to attend festivals and events!  The pandemic made for a challenging year so it feels great to slowly be returning to normalcy. I think above all else I missed seeing familiar faces of colleagues and customers at markets and having little conversations and catch ups.  I look forward to more face to face interaction in the months ahead!

image.alt: Harmony Arts Festival, Matthew Freed Pottery,

content.title: A new deep green glaze with navy speckled undertones
content.body: It's always fun and challenging to put on my chemistry hat and fiddle around with new interesting glazes. I'm really please with the rich tones of my new Garibaldi Glaze Collection. I hope you enjoy it as well!

image.alt: Garibaldi, Matthew Freed, Shorty mug, forest green pottery, pottery mug

content.title: Having fun in 2021
content.body: The early months of the year are always full of a spark of creativity - less pressure means more time to play and try new things. I'm working on some new projects that I can't wait to share with you very soon!

image.alt: Matthew Freed Pottery Studio work large bowl

news.name: A very Happy New Year to all!

content.title: All the very best in 2021
content.body:
Cheers to looking forward to a better year ahead!
Wishing everyone a happy, healthy and festive 2021.

image.alt: Tree of Life Teaset by Matthew Freed

content.body: Wishing everyone a fantastic festive season! Follow my lead and enjoy some decadence!
content.title:
Enjoy your festive season!
Let's put a bow on 2020 and move on!

image.alt: Yaletown Belly Mug in a winter wonderland by Matthew Freed

content.title: New Website Launched!
content.body: I am so thrilled to launch a new swish website this week!  I hope you all enjoy the new slick design and that you find it easy to navigate.  Any feedback is greatly appreciated.  I'm also excited to be able to post updates directly on my site so you can keep up to date with what I am up to.  Thanks to Dan for his brilliant work on this!

image.alt: Matthew Freed - art for everyday life

content.title: Cancellations at the Winter Farmers Market
content.body: Unfortunately I will not be attending the Riley Park Winter Farmers Market tomorrow or on December 12th. Overnight, new government restrictions came into effect that disallow artisans from participating although the market will be running as scheduled. Sadly this was the last door that remained open to me for direct sales this holiday season. I will continue to update my web store as new works are created.

image.alt: Kitsilano Collection: Bowls, Mugs and a Vase by Matthew Freed

content.title: More mugs coming!
content.body: So many blank canvases in the works. It's great to see such a surge in web store activity the last few weeks and to see a whack of locals taking advantage of the delivery option. I'll be updating new products weekly as they are created so keep checking in.

content.title: I'm happy!
content.body: The Eastside Culture Crawl is on (this weekend and next). Nice to see so many familiar faces so far! It's a year of quality versus quantity and I'm really pleased so far. Appointments must be pre-booked: click here

content.title: Support small businesses!
content.body: Here's a sampling of my new work recently taken to the Circle Craft shop at Granville Island. Lots of small businesses on Granville Island could use your love this holiday season - if you are able to support them then please do so.
